definition: A graph depicting the normal distribution of data, shaped like a bell.
example: The test scores followed a bell curve.
example_translation: Wyniki testów układały się w krzywą dzwonową.

definition: To differ or move away from a set course or norm.
example: The results deviate from the expected pattern.
example_translation: Wyniki odbiegają od oczekiwanego wzoru.

definition: A measure of the amount of variation or dispersion in a set of values.
example: The standard deviation of the test scores was 5 points.
example_translation: Odchylenie standardowe wyników testu wyniosło 5 punktów.

definition: The range or scope of something.
example: We need to determine the extent of the damage.
example_translation: Musimy określić zakres szkód.

definition: To make certain that something will occur or be the case.
example: Please ensure that all lights are turned off before you leave.
example_translation: Proszę upewnić się, że wszystkie światła są wyłączone przed wyjściem.

definition: Having a sound basis in logic or fact; reasonable or cogent.
example: The ticket is valid for one month.
example_translation: Bilet jest ważny przez jeden miesiąc.

definition: Consistently good in quality or performance; able to be trusted.
example: He is a reliable employee.
example_translation: Jest niezawodnym pracownikiem.

definition: Acting or done in the same way over time, especially so as to be fair or accurate.
example: Her results are consistent across all tests.
example_translation: Jej wyniki są spójne we wszystkich testach.

definition: A function that represents the distribution of many random variables as a symmetrical bell-shaped graph.
example: The data follows a normal distribution.
example_translation: Dane podążają za rozkładem normalnym.

definition: A collection of related sets of information composed of separate elements.
example: We analyzed a set of data from various sources.
example_translation: Analizowaliśmy zbiór danych z różnych źródeł.

definition: The arithmetic average of a set of values.
example: The mean score of the test was 75.
example_translation: Średnia wyniku testu wyniosła 75.

definition: Without method or conscious decision; indiscriminately.
example: The participants were selected at random.
example_translation: Uczestnicy zostali wybrani losowo.

definition: A variable whose values depend on outcomes of a random phenomenon.
example: X is a random variable representing the number of heads in a coin toss.
example_translation: X to zmienna losowa reprezentująca liczbę orłów w rzucie monetą.

definition: The possible results of an experiment or event.
example: We need to evaluate the outcomes of the study.
example_translation: Musimy ocenić wyniki badania.

definition: A function that describes the likelihood of obtaining the possible values of a random variable.
example: The probability distribution for rolling a die is uniform.
example_translation: Rozkład prawdopodobieństwa rzutu kostką jest jednolity.

definition: A part, share, or number considered in comparative relation to a whole.
example: A large proportion of the students passed the exam.
example_translation: Duża część studentów zdała egzamin.

definition: The quantitative relation between two amounts, showing the number of times one value is contained within the other.
example: The ratio of teachers to students is 1:20.
example_translation: Stosunek nauczycieli do uczniów wynosi 1:20.

definition: The amount of space that a substance or object occupies, or that is enclosed within a container.
example: The volume of the box is 3 cubic meters.
example_translation: Objętość pudełka wynosi 3 metry sześcienne.

definition: To differ from an established course or norm.
example: The experiment's results deviate from the original hypothesis.
example_translation: Wyniki eksperymentu różnią się od pierwotnej hipotezy.

definition: To differ from the average or standard.
example: His behavior deviates from the norm.
example_translation: Jego zachowanie odbiega od normy.

definition: A measure of the amount of variation or dispersion in a set of values from the average.
example: A low standard deviation indicates that the data points tend to be close to the mean.
example_translation: Niskie odchylenie standardowe wskazuje, że punkty danych mają tendencję do zbliżania się do średniej.

translation: connections, often as cause and effect
definition: Mutual relationships or connections between two or more things.
example: There are strong correlations between smoking and lung cancer.
example_translation: Istnieją silne powiązania między paleniem a rakiem płuc.

definition: A subset of a population selected for measurement or observation.
example: The sample consisted of 200 individuals from various age groups.
example_translation: Próbka składała się z 200 osób z różnych grup wiekowych.

definition: Acting or done in the same way over time.
example: Her performance was consistent throughout the season.
example_translation: Jej występ był spójny przez cały sezon.

definition: In a way that is sufficiently great or important to be worthy of attention.
example: The new policy significantly improved company morale.
example_translation: Nowa polityka znacznie poprawiła morale firmy.
